page.title: 19 AGRICULTURE (3),MAIDSTONE
page.content: the area. It was also found that the alkalinity of the soil varied within each geological type as well as within areas covered by the same land use. For example:{Hythe Beds}had a pH of between 6 and 8, the{Folkestone Beds} had a pH of between 6 and 9 and{Head } deposits a pH of 9.5. A wheat field at 759585 on Gault Clay gave two readings of pH8.5 and 9. The choice of crop grown also seems to affect/be affected by the pH values: e.g. At 749584, Grassland, pH6.0 At 759585, Wheat, pH 8.5 At 729562, Orchard, pH8.0 {Intensive methods}allow a decreasing dependency on existing soil type and an increased use of artificial fertilizers.pH readings often reflect farmers additions,so the above should be read with care! by Katharine Chapman and Alison Kemp
